message:
Ooeoeoekay, seems like this is the hype for today? SublimeText clone in every aspect ?
this following is a clone in commandline
story: Emad Elsaid shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: slap-editor/slap
caption: github.com

data.message: Interesting. I always thought a console-based editor would be nice, but being a dark matter developer I was always scared by the vim and brothers crap. Good to see people ae moving this in some good direction, although the "yet another sublime clones" is silly I agree.

You sometimes can't avoid the console and if you're not a vim person it's gonna be a real pain. I like that the dev just took something everyone finds useful and made it available in a new useful way. This is not a clone, this is what we should call incremental progress.

In my enterprisy work I don't need to edit files in the console. I almost never touch the production environment except with log viewer tools, etc. anyway. The deployment and changes are always done via CI. When I'm working locally from the console (PowerShell most often), it's very easy to run sublime on a particular file or even explorer on current folder
